caption: Highly recommend. Every single dish was delicious. First time dining Afghani cuisine - glad we did. Wait staff extremely courteous and gracious. Great dining experience.
Excellent food, presentation, welcome and  environment... Liked everything...
Quite good, generous quantities of food.

Consistently delicious food. I have been coming here for decades and this past weekend introduced my wife to Afghan Grill. She has spent decades working in Afghanistan and says this is the closest she's found to what she eats in-country. The aushak leek dumplings, mantoo meat dumplings and kadu buranee sauteed pumpkin in yogurt are all great appetizers -- and I'm hugely partial to the qubili palao, with its perfectly cooked saffron rice, steamed carrots and raisins, and generous portions of succulent lamb chunks. Please support this place! It's a gem.

Honestly we loved this small hidden restaurant. The manager and servers were amazing, warm, and funny. They were very welcoming to my large, loud, and energetic family and friends 😂 . The food was great, and I am very picky. I have never had Afghan food and am now very open to try something new again.
We ordered take out and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back!
Great spot!  I strongly recommend it!
Too expensive
Good food and well decorated!
Excellent food. Excellent services. Came from Chicago...

I was in the area on sunday and we decide to go to Afghan grill for dinner. First of all they are very over priced for the amount of food you get. We order the mantu, bologna, and the meat samosas. The mantu barely had any meat in it all I tasted was onions. The bologna seemed like it was fry in cold oil cause it was soaked in oil. The somosas was burned and also absolutely no meat in it. They took a half a bologna and sliced up in little pieces. My husband ordered the mix combo the lamb wasnt cooked the shrimp tasted like it was boil.  Overall the food was horrible. I wouldn't recommend this place. I'm an Afghan and I know this place wasnt owned by an afghan, cause Afghan wouldn't serve food like that. On top of all that they serve alcohol. If I would have know I wouldn't have gone there and spend my money.
Excellent food with great vegetarian options

Portions are nice, price is competitive, and the food is delicious! There is so much flavor and the kabob is not overcooked at all. Everything down to the rice is seasoned and cooked wonderfully. I ordered delivery from them and my only issue was something that actually was the fault of the delivery service. Even so, when I called the owner answered and was very patient and generous even though the mistake was not his fault. I won’t be in D.C long enough to order again this trip, but I look forward to eating from this restaurant again in the future.  Edit: AND I was so excited that the menu is quite authentic.
Good authentic Afghan food.
Vegetable combo was fantastic and delicious. Highly recommend it.  Good service,  the owner is such a nice guy.
Wanna have amazing and yummy food? Go eat at Afghan Grill and enjoy authentic food.

Food is alright. Staff is approachable. However, after the bill payment while asking for a receipt staff seemed unprepared. Once a copy was printed and provided I was able to see around 15 dollar tip on the bill which I wasn't asked about. Staff first said this is the service charge. Later he said, the manager have put that in the computer while preparing our bill and the staff are never paid the tip. Also staff salary is not adequate. These experience seemed dodgy to me and I won't go back again to be played or scammed by staff and management.
Loved the Turkish coffee. Food is decent enough
The service was amazing. Atmosphere was nice. Food was incredible Presentation was ok. But overall definitely will go again!

No. I'm not even Afghani and I can tell you this is not good Afghani food. Just not good food. I don't like to write bad reviews as you can see from my history. If I don't like a place I just don't go back. I hope this can serve as a wake up call to the owners. Service was fine and our waiter was extremely friendly. The food was not worth what we paid. I can get a lamb over rice that tastes way better for $6. Everything tasted like it was cooked and then just reheated. The salad tasted and looked like it was made the day before. Kofta was certainly cooked and reheated on grill. Rice most likely microwaved. Also silverware and glasses were dirty. Nope not again.
Terrible, salty food - seemed reheated. Dirty glasses and utensils. Would never go back.
No worries, y'all exceeded my expectations. My bad I thought it was another grill restaurant

I would have given zero star to this place if possible unfortunately that is not the case here and I had to end up goving it 1 star. Worst afghani food ever tasted by me look at the picture this is how returned the plate the left over which looks almost full in the picture is because i couldn’t eat anymore even though I was starving. Chicken was mixed with lamb, staff changed the plate first time then came the new plate but was still mixed with lamb. FAKE OVER EXPENSIVE NOWHERE CLOSE TO AFGHAN CUISINE

Expensive prices comparing with the amount of food and the taste wasn’t that good. Also, the service literally was terrible. I get to the restaurant with no sounds and then group of people came and made the worker plays DJ with much noisy. I asked him to lower the volume but he doesn’t!. Worst restaurant experience
Cozy comfort with exvellent food and friendly staff.

Greatly exceeded my expectations. I tried the bread, a Lamb dish, a vegetarian dish, coffee/tea, and dessert. Everything was perfectly seasoned, with some unique flavors that were surprisingly delicious. The entree portion sizes are a bit smaller than average for the price but the quality of the food more than makes up for this. Friendly staff and cozy environment too.

You can find the best authentic Afghan food here. The owner was VERY kind, professional, and helpful. Food was really delicious and the service was great. Everything was clean and neat and the sound of music added up to the taste of food and excellent customer service. Thanks for everything!!!!  I really recommend this place for any type of get together or meetings in addition to casual dining with friends and family.  November 24, 2019
Very expensive. Small rice and meat stew me and my wife had the same like dish we end up paying $48 dollars😳😳😳and the food was not even good
I will never ever go in there
Not recommended
Tasty halal food, small portions, little expensive however they also serve alcoholic beverages which I encourage to not to drink.
Best food I've had in DC all week.  The Khorma Chalao had rich flavors and tender chicken. Will make a return visit on my next trip to DC...GO CARDS

Chicken kabobs were plump and juicy, not over grilled like the kabobs I had later that week at a Turkish restaurant. I couldn't put my finger on the seasoning, but it was delicious. Plan to return on my next business trip.
Excellent

I had a particularly fun experience because of the hospitality of the staff and owner. The food is good and is reminiscent of Greek and Indian cuisine. I can recommend the Mantoo dumplings and the pureed pumpkin.
Extraordinary food and hospitality!
First experience with Afghan food.  Tasted great!
Best food we've had in D.C.!

I have been to Afghan restaurants in many countries. So far, this is the worst place in my entire life. This place does not represent Afghan food. Please read comments made by Afghans and then make your decision. The worst food ever
Lam chop with rice is excellent! The owner is a very friendly guy.
Fabulous food nice service.  Great new foods to try and experiment. Great flavours.
In one word 'SUCKS'  street foods are much more batter
The food is good and pricing is fare. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming. Staff were very accommodating. My issues are the entrance is on second floor and the temprature was hot.
Really bad food. The food was tasteless and it has bad smell. Please don’t go.
Great food
Excellent food and nice setting.

Very bad restaurant , food was extremely bad and expensive . Everything we ordered was cooked days before and they just microwaved it . Feel nauseous after eating in that restaurant. Do not recommend it at all.

Had a very bad time here. The room was warm due to poor cooling even though the restaurant is basically a small room. To get to the bathroom you have to go upstairs which is also dirty. The service was very slow, prices were very high compaired to the food quantity and had no taste.  They say the food is Halal yet it is not written anywhere in the restaurant or the menu. Will never come back here. Do not recommend at all.
Griled and rice. Price little high
Great halal food!
We really enjoy this spot the food and service is wonderful. Just that it's not a big inside
Good service, location and furniture.....BUT the food

The food is okay. The palao was not traditional as it was their regular rice with some carrots and raisins on top. The kabobs were good. Do not come here if you can't walk up stairs. Slow service and bathrooms had no running water.
Long wait, but with it the food was very tasty. We had chicken kabab
Good place for Halal food. Average taste.
I went there with 3 other friends. The restaurant is not a reasonable one. Amount of food they serve is little. They also add tips without asking permission or mentioning in the menu card.

Conveniently located just a few minutes walk from the Omni hotel, my wife and I felt like trying Afghan food for the first time. The staff were super kind and accommodating to our ignorance of the food and made recommendations for both of us to share. The taste was absolutely amazing! My wife and I highly recommend giving it a try!

We love coming here on Friday nights. This restaurant is a perfect balance of very decent prices and absolutely fabulous atmosphere with white tablecloths and fine dining. The owner speaks many languages and always very good about offering a little free be like an appetizer. I like being recognized by him and have my own special table :)))
Cozy restaurant with delicious food. In our group the afghani salad, sauteed pumpkin, and ice cream with rosewater and cardamon were big hits.  Will definitely go back on my next visit to DC.

Delicious food with vegetarian options. First time having Afghani food and we enjoyed it. Had fried lentil appetizers, eggplant and spinach-based dishes with rice. They had typical brand beers and wine but no cocktails (even though the menu says they have them). Staff friendly and attentive. Decent atmosphere. Food was a bit pricey ($15-17 for most dishes) but worth it for something different.
Great food, and good service. The lamb is fall off the bone and absolutely fantastic.
i loved the pumpkin appetizer, and the kabab was the best I’ve had in DC
Delicious food and fast service

What amazing food! Seasoned so well.  Beautiful location. We ate there twice. After the first time we knew we could trust the food to be made well and to be tasty. The owner is so nice! I recommend sharing the platter to have a variety of items!! We got it without the meat sauce for my vegetarian friend. I wish I had a restaurant like this near me. Go eat here!!!

I've never had Afghani food, but I'm always ready to try new things. This was a great introduction. First I tried the Sambosa Goshti which was wonderful. It's a pastry-like dough filled with ground beef and chick peas. Then I ordered the Vegetable Combo that comes with kadu (a delicious pumpkin dish with sugar and herbs), eggplant, sabzi (an amazing spinach dish), and rice. It was fabulous! The wait staff are welcoming and attentive; the atmosphere was nice and comfortable. Try it! You won't be disappointed.
Whenever attending the AAG conference, we have meeting there!
Saying they are slow is an understatement
Great food.  So so service.
Worst experience ever
Excellent food. Friendly. Small and quiet. Perfect.
Superb food. Wonderful atmosphere.
Great place to eat kabli pilao
Good shop for Afghani food
Great food but I felt rushed.
Delicious food, excellent service, and reasonably priced.

Went for lunch on a workday.  Service was quick and we were in and out in less than an hour.  Both of us enjoyed our food.  My lamb dish came in a flavorful sauce.  The rice was perfectly cooked.  Bread was provided with spicey dip to eat while waiting for our lunch to be prepared.

We stopped here kind of on a whim. The staff were super attentive, almost doting on us. I almost worried that they were on the edge of going out of business because they were so happy to see us it seemed like we were saving them! But I think that is the regular service. The food was very good, as well. Maybe a bit more expensive than I was thinking, but it was a lot of food and completely worth it.
Very good lunch
Better than anything I had in Afghanistan. Plus I was able to have a beer.  The food was delicious.

Eating this food was like making a new friend. Well more like a pen pal because I'm not from here. The food was fantastic. Also the waiter had the best suggestions for food.  We WILL be going back before we leave. Make a new friend at Afghan Grill!
The food tastes is good but be aware if the guy asked if you want something as tester. None of it is free.
Wonderful food, great hospitality.

An amazing mixture of skilled kabob and grilled meats as well as traditional Afghan home cooking. I can never decide between the dumplings or the kabobs, but I dont have to because most entrees have appetizer portions. This place is a must for all m Mediterranean food lovers.
Good food at reasonable price. We opted for one grilled chicken entree and another lamb rice with Afghan salad and both were good. Service time is also as expected. We would like to come back again
Nice place with traditional Pakhtun food
Excellent food. Nive guy running it.

Our server was very accommodating, even offering options to make some menu items vegetarian for our party of non meat eaters. However there were plenty of delicious choices without having to change a thing. There were plenty of meat options on the menu in addition. Would definitely return for lunch or dinner here.
Excellent and friendly service with plenty of vegetarian options, unique flavors in a pleasant atmosphere.
Quite delicious vegetarian dishes
small and cozy place. delicious lamb.
(Translated by Google) It was a little expensive.  (Original) Estuvo un poco caro.

Went there for my birthday a couple of nights ago and the food was beyond amazing! Totally worth the drive to DC. And the owner of the restaurant was incredibly attentive and kind. Loved this place and would definitely recommend it to anyone that loves great food!
Delicious
Amazing food you won't find in many other places!

Decent place for Afghan food. I very much enjoyed the Bulanee and Mantoo appetizers. We ordered the lamb pulao and the beef kabob entrees. Unfortunately, the staff forgot that we had ordered the pulao and only brought out the kabob dish. We ended up cancelling the pulao dish because it had been 1 hour since we ordered and we had to head out. The beef kabob dish was pretty good. Glad to know that all the meat served here is Halal (although ironic that they unfortunately also serve alcohol here as well). All in all, it was pretty good food but under average service. Probably wouldn't return here again.
Did not eat from here because while categorized as halal they serve wine
Best lamb chops I have ever put in my mouth! Their pumpkin dish is a must try!
I recommend that place if you like Afghan food.
Beautifully prepared Afghan food in a pleasant setting. I inhaled the eggplant dish at lunch and wished for more. Highly recommended.
Good place to eat afghani food.🥗🍽👍

My husband served in Afghanistan with the Army and had Qabili Palao there and really enjoyed it.  So,  we had to try this restaurant. He ordered the Qabili Palao and it was better than he remembered and I was amazed by the flavor also. I ordered Mantoo and it was delicious.  The meals are fantastic and the service was exceptional.  I highly recommend this restaurant .
This food was really really good n
We had a delightful meal.  They stayed open late and provided wonderful service.
Absolutely delicious food and a very friendly environment. I tried few other afghan restaurants in/near DC while I was visiting, but this place is by far my favorite.
At’s not real Afghan food at’s fake Afghan food
Best dinner we have had in a long time. Loved it!
Good Food
It's been 3 years since I've eaten here but I loved it so much I tell everyone. This is a "do not miss" DC restaurant!
Very good food.
Good food, friendly service.
Solid Afghan food, exceptional service
I ordered qabli, it was not even qabli. The didn’t worth 5 $ but the price was 20$ with tax.

Sat down for a late dinner and told the waiter to bring me what he would order... Did not disappoint!   Kadu Buranee, Lamb Chops, Firnee... All perfectly paired with hand picked wines and Cardamom Tea. Attentive staff, lovely atmosphere. You need to try this place for a romantic date or quiet evening meal.

This was my husband and I’s first time eating Afghan  food. We were not disappointed! We ate outside as it was a beautiful evening in DC!  The food: we ordered Afghan bread, mantoo, and split the lamb kabobs! The Afghan bread was delicious, the sauce served with it was very bold so just lightly dip! The mantoo is a beef filled dumpling with a tomato and yogurt sauce, so yummy! The lamb kabobs was definitely our favorite! The meat was well seasoned and grilled to perfection! Ohhh! For dessert we split the firnee; a cool custard topped with pistachios... great ending to a lovely meal!  The service: our server was so polite and attentive! We were a bit nervous as other reviewers stated the service was sub par. We are happy we took the chance! Everything was wonderful!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant!
(Translated by Google) Delicious meals and grills .. Arabic and Islamic  (Original) وجبات ومشويات لذيذه ..عربيه وإسلاميه

Super restaurant in Woodley park. We were in a big rush (40 mins to eat) and we took a peak in and decided to go somewhere else. The server (and maybe owner?) came to us and convinced us that the food would be ready in 5 mins and we would not be late. Sure enough he delivered! Even better, the food was fantastic!! The mantoo was super fresh and the dumpling dough was soft and delicate. Everyone else got some type of kebab (beef, chicken, and lamb) and we were all very satisfied. The meat was fresh, tender, and very well prepared. Food was excellent, service was excellent, and we came away very, very happy.
Delicious!
Came from New York to DC tour Afghan grill food was delicious and polite staff.
Nice decor and great food but prices are a little high for what you get.
The food is incredible and the owner is responsive to customers.  Try it!
Amazing food and service! I was in love with the bread and sauce hate that I’m back in Chicago I could go for a lot more!

Made us wait 50mins watching other eat because they do not take reservations. At the last min then gave our promised table away to someone because they accept reservations weeks in advance. Habib was nice but just led us in. Wish they get their act together for reservations
(Translated by Google) Cozy and very tasty 🤤  (Original) Уютно и очень вкусно 🤤
Authentic afghani food. Food is great
Very good Food

Upsides: Entrees were excellent (chicken kabob, lamb kebob, beef teka kabob, and beef dumplings) and will certainly bring me back. The ambiance was warm and intimate. Downsides: The food came out quickly, but otherwise the service was very slow (5+ minutes before we were greeted at the table or given water, and we repeatedly had to flag down the waiter for more water throughout the meal). This is why I took off a star. The only other negative was that the rosewater in the custard was too heavy (although, admittedly, I'm not a huge fan of rosewater).
Try the mixed grill plate and the mantoo. They are really good here. The grilled chicken is really tender and tasty. Service is excellent and the waiter is very friendly.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. As everyone is at brunch trying to get their fill of mimosas and bloody mary's, an Afghani restaurant such as this was pretty empty. Service was fast and delightful. The food was a little bit pricier than what I expected, but still not bad considering how good the food is.
The best food in Dc
this place is completely opposite of what i heard from my friends the steak was bloody and it was not lamb and rice were left over potato sauce were bad we all got sick after eating there
Odd entrance, buy don't let that stop you. Great food
The food was delicious and service was excellent! Highly recommend!

One of my favorite restaurants in DC. Absolutely love this place. The food is delicious and the Afghan family that owns it are wonderful. My husband and I ended up having our rehearsal dinner here (since we had our first date at Afghan Grill!). We don’t live in DC anymore but every time we go back this restaurant is our first stop!! Fantastic place!
Nice view. Beef items recommended
Very good service and the food was quite nice as well.
For Halal food
Dissapointing quantity too small to prize not fresh smell
Very bad food, doesn’t look like Afghan food. Waste of money and time. Never go again ever.

Amazing service, beautiful music, and delicious food!! We ordered manti and lamb kabob. They were very good!! Afgan Grill is above and beyond all of the expectations!! The owner is extremely welcoming. I would definitely would recommend it to everyone!!

Quiet place, with pretensions of grandeur. Go there, if you like exotic food customized for American taste buds. If you are a Desi South Asian, then not the place for you. Other than that, service is quick, food fresh and staff polite and attentive.
Meh
this restaurant chiefs has no idea how Kabuli pulaw is made,
Small pastries are delicious. Place to eat. Not reasonably priced wine list, no special drinks except cardamom tea.

This place is a joke. Looks like the wife owner is the waitress. She was constantly feeding her husband every time she comes out of the kitchen. Who knows if she washes her hand. The food is the lowest quality you can find. The prices are ridiculously high. Now the food: we ordered the grill combo and chicken texture was like rubber, asked the chef and responded yes it's "afghan chicken". We could only eat the rice and salad from the grill plate. The lamb was fairly good but beef was salty as dried fish or jerky. After all this, the waitress had the guts to bring the check and adding tip without my consent. There are many Afghani options within 2 mile radius, better off somewhere else.
This is another best place to eat & I recommend it to everybody if u have a taste for that type of food. It's really good & u have to try it if u're in the area.
Food was good, but a little expensive.
Delicious Afghan food for the price.
Pricey and meals are small unlike other afghan locations
Meh
We love the Kanu Buranee.
Wonderful people, terrific cuisine
Great ethnic dishes and desserts. Delivery available through GrubHub. Try the lamb! Reasonable, satisfying portions.
A very bad experience. The food is not real Afghan food. Just waste of money.
The food was no good
Absolutely loved the food, it was very fresh and tasty. The owner personally  tends to all tables making sure you are being taken care of
This is the worst food, at all that is NOT Afghan food, don't waste your money and time, we had food from here. Not a food from my country, using Afghan name.

Skip it. I'd been craving Afghan food, this didn't help. The waiter asked if I wanted bread, I said ok. He didn't tell me that 8 small pieces of stale bread would cost 2 dollars. It came with chutney which tasted good, until I saw chunks of bread that were floating in it, it obviously wasn't fresh and they were re-using it. The aushak tasted fine, the leeks were a bit undercooked, and the sauce was uneven and not and meaty or smooth as it should be. Additionally for 17 dollars I only received 7 dumplings which were not very big and probably old because two of them were stuck together like they had cooled. To top it off, they tried to make me pay with cash by claiming that the credit card machine wasn't working because of the internet? even though there are the various credit card logos posted on the door.  I would NOT recommend this place. I just hope I don't get food poisoning.
Kabab is the best
Love this place,  first time here.  The lamb chops were recommended,  absolutely amazing!!!!
Great food and nice people/service!
Awful service and very dirty.  DO NOT EAT HERE.  The food was cold, poorly prepared, and the bathrooms were filthy.
Friendly service. Meats overdone, rest of food tasted OK. Compared to many other Afghan restaurants in the area this place is sub par. And, bathroom infrastructure dumpy.
Very cozy place with great food and service.  Pretty good prices for Washington too.
Small. Overpriced liquor.
Pretty decent vegetarian options
Everything is excellent m

The place was empty and we had it to ourselves. Everything order was fresh and very tasty. Having very little knowlege of this type food we took ques from the establishment. Was a great meal agreat time and friendly service. Will eat here again the next time we go to the zoo. We are from se pa and would make the drive again to eat here.

At dinner here while in DC for a conference. Was packed on a Friday night, manager brought an extra table out for the four of us. Service was prompt and friendly, food came out fast and fresh, delicious. I had the chicken kabob, very very good.
The food, the service, the atmosphere, EVERYTHING was absolutely amazing!! We will definitely be back!!

well not what we had thought. this is probebly a good food for americans that has no idea of afghan food. the only thing wagly close to an afghan taste was the afghan salad ( salata). the safran rice was more brown than yellow, which a safran rice should be. and they had just put in the water and put in the plate,more chinese taste and way of kocking. $6 meet samosas are 95% onion. nothing worted those pricings. all in all i do not recomended to any one, especially not afghans. waste of money.

This place is pretty bomb. Good service, good food. Kafta kebab was a flavor explosion. I was surprised at how good it was. The rice was crazy good too. Saffron with red sauce. Rice is not normally something people write home about but in this case Afghan grill is killing it! My only regret is not going all in with a yogurt side and bread. Next time!

Portions were smaller than what I am used to at real afghan places. The flavors were good. $22.00 for shish kabab, lamb kabab and chicken kabab.  The service was good if you want to be left alone, not if you are the needy type.
Every bite was delicious. Great flavoring, good size portions and such a special meal. Must visit!!!
I recommend the appetizer sampler, it's just as good as en entire entree (and the same price) but allows you to try a few things. Great service and the staff are very nice.
Food was amazing alittle expensive for the portion size though. But I recommend it!

I ordered Mantoo, an amazing meat stuffed dumpling appetizers with meat sauce. Two different spices on the meats made a match of flavors that was quite tasty. My entree was Qabili Palo a lamb dish with saffron rice covered with carrots and raisins.  A splendid dish. A great meal. Hghly recommend.
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Excelente

While trying to pass some time near the metro stop, we looked at menus at the local restaurants. While at this one, a man who appeared to be the owner stepped out and really tried to get us into his place. Talked about how his lamb was best around. Then about how his food wasn't spicy like Indian kabobs. We said that we were only a little hungry but we're looking at menus for later, he said that "everyone says that," then offered a free appetizer if we came in. We thanked him, but told him maybe later. We looked at a few others then decided to give Afghan food a try as it was new to us.  We decided to try the combination platter appetizer and the combination kabob. We told him not to worry about the free appetizer, but he said he would keep his word, and would bring us one of the smaller ones. Shortly after, he brought us a plate of bread and said "everyone gets this." We also saw him giving the bread to other customers shortly after they arrived.  The food was good, we all enjoyed the appetizers, especially the one that looked like ravioli (tasted way better). Kabob meat had a slightly charred outside and tender center. Service was also attentive and friendly.  Prices were a bit higher than I would think of as fair for what we got. Then the bill came and we noticed a 1.99 charge for "braed" (we assume bread?) Which caught us of guard because it was given to us. We just paid it because it was a tiny portion of the total bill, but it definitely seemed unfair. If this had not occurred, I would have rated a 4. If you do not want that $1.99 charge, make sure to tell them, "No bread!"

Foods are spoilage and we found "hair" into the food. We showed to stuff and owner. Owner is so disappointing us and told us we put the hair into the food. He verified the camera and finally he figure out that was their fault, but he never apologies for that and he was so rude with us and said that he hate Muslim people. he is stupid liar and racist i ever seen.  Don't go this people are racist......

Excellent food, very tasty, savory, and spicy. Rather simple menu but each item was packed full of flavor, well worth the reasonable prices (less the $20/dinner). Service was adequate and timely.  Was hoping to find some cocktails/beer/wine that might have been authentic to the region (or at least some unique Middle Easter tonics or teas) but to no avail; Miller Lt, Guinness, and Heineken lead to minus 1 star. Settled for Turkish Coffee which was quite good.  Def. worth the stop. Broaden your horizons
Tasteful, respectful. I love it

This is a tiny place that's good for an intimate date. Delicious food with unique flavor. Very good sweet/savory combinations for the spices. I did feel that the portions could be slightly bigger. It's also a bit on the pricey side.
Great atmosphere and delicious food. Very well done!

2014.09.28: Beautiful, cozy interior (we sat right next to the window at night) and great service! We were getting food to go, but they brought us water and salad and bread while we waited. The salad was good, and the rest of he food we had was good but not excellent. I liked the pumpkin entree, but the lamb kebab was overcooked.

I really like this restaurant - delicious Afghan food at decent prices. The Kadu Buranee is my favorite- they do a great job with the pumpkin and it's spiced perfectly. Haven't tried the desserts here (yet!).
Good portions and good flavor. The sampler is a great sharing appetizer.
Great food, nice staff, busy!
I spent a year in Kabul as a civilian advisor, and this "reminded me of home" in a sense. Loved it.
